overview: Die dapper kleremaketjie is a short tale by Hans Christian Andersen translated to Afrikaans about two weavers who promise an Emperor a new suit of clothes that is invisible to those unfit for their positions, stupid, or incompetent. When the Emperor parades before his subjects in his new clothes, a child cries out, "But he isn't wearing anything at all!"
title: Die dapper kleremakertjie
